intro: Lindsaea falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Bromeliaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often recurved, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees or rocks in its natural habitat. The plant's inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that are often overlooked due to its foliage being more prominent.
